intro: Hoffmannseggia aphylla, commonly known as the leafless burrobrush, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of North America. It is characterized by its lack of leaves, with photosynthesis occurring through its green stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Hoffmannseggia aphylla plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
